meanings.definition: A type of tree with tough, flexible wood.
meanings.sent1: The sauchs in the forest provide shade and shelter for many animals.
meanings.sent2: I collected some sauchs to build a sturdy fence around the garden.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the sauchs as a balance beam, showing off its acrobatic skills.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the sauchs, bending but never breaking.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind rustling through the sauchs was calming and peaceful.

meanings.sent1: He sauchs around the room, knocking over everything in his path.
meanings.sent2: The toddler sauchs towards his favorite toy, stumbling over his own feet.
meanings.sent3: She sauchs through the dance routine, trying to keep up with the steps.
meanings.sent4: The robot sauchs across the room, its movements jerky and uncoordinated.
meanings.sent5: The zombie sauchs towards its next meal, arms outstretched in a clumsy manner.

meanings.definition: A derogatory term for a person who is lazy or incompetent.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a sauchs and start working on your assignments!
meanings.sent2: He always blames others for his mistakes, what a sauchs!
meanings.sent3: The cat lounges in the sun all day, living the life of a sauchs.
meanings.sent4: Her brother is such a sauchs, never helping with chores around the house.
meanings.sent5: The manager fired the sauchs who never showed up on time for work.
